medium_description_en: Stages breast cancer based on tumor, lymph nodes, and metastases.
instructions_en: This calculator is based on the 7th edition of the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. An update based on the 8th edition is currently in progress.

seo.meta_description_en: TNM Staging for Breast Cancer stages breast cancer based on tumor, lymph node, and metastasis characteristics.
seo.keywords_en: tnm, breast ca, breast cancer, ductal breast CA, situ, lobular breast ca, breast tumor, breast lymph, breast mets, breast metastasis

how_to_use.use_case_en: Patients with breast cancer who have had biopsy.
how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en:
• The tumor node metastasis (TNM) system stages breast cancer; stage then prognosticates outcome of patients.
  • The staging system is frequently updated in response to new technologies and treatments.
how_to_use.why_use_en: The TNM system is the standard staging system used by oncologists to both prognosticate and communicate clearly about patients.

next_steps.advice_en: Use the TNM system once breast cancer diagnosis is biopsy confirmed.

about.formula_en:
Staging based on multiple factors including:

  • Primary Tumor (T) characteristics
  • Regional lymph nodes (N)
    • Clinical
    • Pathological
  • Distant metastasis (M)

creator_info.about_en: Richard Theriault, DO, is a professor in the breast medical oncology and critical care departments at the University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center. He also is a trainer for the Tokyo-based Japanese TeamOncology Leadership Academy and J-HOPE Clinical Research Skill Advancement Workshop. Dr. Theriault has led multiple breast cancer research efforts and published over 180 peer reviewed articles, numerous book chapters and teaching publications.
